mutants.code:
import re

def find_palindromes(text):
    """
    This function takes a string of text as input, identifies the distinct palindromic sequences 
    (case-insensitive and without considering punctuation as part of palindromes), 
    and returns the count and the set of distinct palindromes.

    Args:
        text (str): The input text.

    Returns:
        tuple: A tuple containing the count and the set of distinct palindromes.
    """
    words = re.findall('', text.lower())
    palindromes = set()
    for word in words:
        if word == word[::-1]:
            palindromes.add(word)
    return (len(palindromes), palindromes)

mutants.original_line: if word == word[::-1]:   # Check if the word is the same when reversed
mutants.code:
import re

def find_palindromes(text):
    """
    This function takes a string of text as input, identifies the distinct palindromic sequences 
    (case-insensitive and without considering punctuation as part of palindromes), 
    and returns the count and the set of distinct palindromes.

    Args:
        text (str): The input text.

    Returns:
        tuple: A tuple containing the count and the set of distinct palindromes.
    """
    words = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', text.lower())
    palindromes = set()
    for word in words:
        if word != word[::-1]:
            palindromes.add(word)
    return (len(palindromes), palindromes)

import re

def find_palindromes(text):
    """
    This function takes a string of text as input, identifies the distinct palindromic sequences 
    (case-insensitive and without considering punctuation as part of palindromes), 
    and returns the count and the set of distinct palindromes.

    Args:
        text (str): The input text.

    Returns:
        tuple: A tuple containing the count and the set of distinct palindromes.
    """
    words = re.findall('\\b\\w+\\b', text.lower())
    palindromes = set()
    for word in words:
        if word == word[::--1]:
            palindromes.add(word)
    return (len(palindromes), palindromes)
